channel.title: Brandon Boswell
channel.description: Recent content from Brandon Boswell's Digital Garden

item.title: ACCESS method
item.description: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p0zWJ-TLghw My initial impression was that the video serves a great foundation and example to prove to people that links and folders can coexist in a PKM system. I found that I landed on a very similar system between in my use of Obsidian and Arc.
item.content:encoded:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p0zWJ-TLghw

My initial impression was that the video serves a great foundation and example to prove to people that links and folders can coexist in a PKM system.

I found that I landed on a very similar system between in my use of Obsidian and Arc. I found personally that PARA was not a great fit for Obsidian (You can watch that video here).

I don’t currently have multiple spaces in my Obsidian vault because I try to keep work things out of it (and in the work Notion), but I could see that being a good fit for people who do want/need to maintain work notes in their vault.

Overall, I would say check out the ACCESS method and grab the parts of it that make sense and work for you.

item.title: Handwritten content has additional metadata
item.description: Analog Tools How you were feeling at that moment will be subtlety captured in your writing and drawing in a way that is lost in most digital capture tools.
item.content:encoded:
Analog Tools

How you were feeling at that moment will be subtlety captured in your writing and drawing in a way that is lost in most digital capture tools.

If you were stressed, tired, worried, or rushed, it will likely be recognize-able in your writing.

item.title: Should you exercise more as you age?
item.description: I don’t know the answer to this question, hence why I asked it. One thing I believe to be true is that our metabolism slows as we age. I believe this to be a factor in why most people get heavier as they get old.
item.content:encoded:
I don’t know the answer to this question, hence why I asked it. One thing I believe to be true is that our metabolism slows as we age. I believe this to be a factor in why most people get heavier as they get old. In thinking about that, I think it might be worthwhile to increase my number of workouts each week from 1 to 2. One was previously all that was necessary to meet my health and fitness goals, but as I grow older, this will likely not be enough.

Weight is a lagging measure of our eating and exercise habits.

item.title: Write journal entries for your future self
item.description: You will be much more likely to complete them today because current you is disappointed when past you didn’t fill one out from a year ago. I got this idea from Mark McElroy
item.content:encoded: You will be much more likely to complete them today because current you is disappointed when past you didn’t fill one out from a year ago. I got this idea from Mark McElroy

item.title: How I Tricked My Brain To Like Doing Hard Things (dopamine detox)
item.description: Author: Better than Yesterday URL: https://youtu.be/9QiE-M1LrZk The video talked about how as our bodies are fed more and more Dopamine they will need more and more to be satisfied due to Homeostatis.
item.content:encoded:
• Author: Better than Yesterday
  • URL: https://youtu.be/9QiE-M1LrZk

The video talked about how as our bodies are fed more and more Dopamine they will need more and more to be satisfied due to Homeostatis.

The video brought up that we look at our phones constantly in hopes of getting notifications as little Dopamine hits. In thinking about myself, this is probably why I’m more likely to empty my RSS feed instead of reading the best articles from yesterday that I have curated. I’m going to the feed in hopes of finding something fun and exciting to trigger the Dopamine hit.

The video recommends a Dopamine Detox where on a certain day you avoid all sources of dopamine in hopes of lowering your required thresholds.

In the video, he recommends linking your low-dopamine activities that you need to do to push you forward with the high dopamine activities as a reward for completing them. This is similar to what I did after reading Atomic Habits where I would reward myself for working out with a night of video games.

item.title: Revisiting the journal entry from this day one year ago
item.description: Simple template I created to embed last year’s journal entry into today’s template to allow spontaneous Reflection.
item.content:encoded: Simple template I created to embed last year’s journal entry into today’s template to allow spontaneous Reflection.

item.title: Journaling generates value from introspection and retrospection
item.description: Journaling generates value in two ways: Introspection Retrospection You gain introspective value through looking inward and exploring yourself while writing the journal entry. Not every day will generate this, but if you participate in the process then most days can be this way.
item.content:encoded:
Journaling generates value in two ways:

  • Introspection
  • Retrospection

You gain introspective value through looking inward and exploring yourself while writing the journal entry. Not every day will generate this, but if you participate in the process then most days can be this way.

You gain retrospective value when you revisit those journal entries at a later date. I do this through Weekly Reflection and by Revisiting the journal entry from this day one year ago

item.title: Everything is a journal if you revisit it
item.description: Don’t really keep a journal? No worries. Try doing this exercise with your phone’s camera roll … or even your credit card charges — Mark McElroy The benefit of the journal is the insight gained when revisited.
item.content:encoded:
Don’t really keep a journal? No worries. Try doing this exercise with your phone’s camera roll … or even your credit card charges — Mark McElroy

The benefit of the journal is the insight gained when revisited. If we fail to revisit it we will only gain insight from the initial introspection.

Window Managers MacOS

item.title: Arc First Impressions
item.description: A really well-designed browser that understands that people have different contexts. Note that it’s bookmarks can’t be read by Alfred, but aside from that it works with all of my other browser shortcuts.
item.content:encoded:
A really well-designed browser that understands that people have different contexts.

Note that it’s bookmarks can’t be read by Alfred, but aside from that it works with all of my other browser shortcuts. It was a pretty drop in replacement as a Google Chrome user.

Shortcuts

  • CMD+SHIFT+C: Copy new URL
  • CMD+N: New Window
  • CMD+S: Hide Sidebar
  • CMD+SHIFT+W: Close Window (Note that tab state is shared across windows)

FYI Figma users

  • 2022-08-23: Fixed issue where I couldn’t use the refresh keyboard shortcut in Figma from Arc browser. I was able to fix this by setting that shortcut to prefer the website’s shortcut in the Shortcut menu.
